title: Social Democratic Party (Japan, 1901)
text:
Social Democratic Party () was the first <a href="socialist">socialist</a> party in the <a href="Empire%20of%20Japan">Empire of Japan</a>. The party was banned by the government of Japan only one day after its foundation.
The party was founded by <a href="Kinoshita%20Naoe">Kinoshita Naoe</a>, <a href="Kiyoshi%20Kawakami">Kiyoshi Kawakami</a>, , <a href="Sen%20Katayama">Sen Katayama</a>, <a href="Abe%20Isoo">Abe Isoo</a>, and <a href="K%C5%8Dtoku%20Sh%C5%ABsui">Kōtoku Shūsui</a>. Kinoshita and Katayama were nominated as administrative secretaries. All the six founders except Kōtoku Shūsui were <a href="christians">christians</a> at the time. When composing the platform, the founders took the platform of <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20of%20Germany">Social Democratic Party of Germany</a> (SDP) as the reference. The first article of the platform of the social democratic party was "the aim of our party is to achieve socialism (in Japan)".
